TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ECDiffieHellmanOpenSsl extends System.Security.Cryptography.ECDiffieHellman
Public NotInheritable Class ECDiffieHellmanOpenSsl Inherits ECDiffieHellman

Docs.summary: Provides an implementation of the Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman (ECDH) algorithm backed by OpenSSL.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This class should only be used directly when doing platform interop with the system OpenSSL library. When platform interop is not needed, you should use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDiffieHellman.Create%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> factory methods instead of a specific derived implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a default curve of NIST P-521/secp521r1.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This constructor does not generate a new public/private keypair immediately, it just sets the size which will be used to generate a key when one is needed. If key is loaded via the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDiffieHellmanOpenSsl.ImportParameters%2A> method, or other key import method, the key size from this constructor has no meaning.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 keySize) cil managed

Docs.param: The size of the key to generate, when a key is needed.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class defaulting to the NIST prime curve of the specified size.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Only three key sizes are supported by this constructor: 256 (NIST P-256/secp256r1), 384 (NIST P-384/secp384r1), and 521 (NIST P-521/secp521r1). To generate keys For any other curve, use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDiffieHellmanOpenSsl.%23ctor(System.Security.Cryptography.ECCurve)> constructor or the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDiffieHellmanOpenSsl.GenerateKey(System.Security.Cryptography.ECCurve)> method.
This constructor does not generate a new public/private keypair immediately, it just sets the size which will be used to generate a key when one is needed. If key is loaded via the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDiffieHellmanOpenSsl.ImportParameters%2A> method, or other key import method, the key size from this constructor has no meaning.

Docs.exception: The value is not supported by this implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int handle) cil managed

Docs.param: The OpenSSL EC_KEY* value to use as the key.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from an existing OpenSSL key represented as an EC_KEY*.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!IMPORTANT] > OpenSSL supports multiple library versions being loaded within the same process. > Before calling this constructor verify your pointer value came from the same version of OpenSSL that this class uses, see <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SafeEvpPKeyHandle.OpenSslVersion> for more information.

Docs.exception: is .
is not a valid EC_KEY*.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and generates a new key on the specified curve.
Docs.exception: does not validate.

Docs.param: The OpenSSL EVP_PKEY* value to use as the key, represented as a .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from an existing OpenSSL key represented as an EVP_PKEY*.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > OpenSSL supports multiple library versions being loaded within the same process. > Before calling this constructor, verify your pointer value came from the same version of OpenSSL that this class uses. > For more information, see <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SafeEvpPKeyHandle.OpenSslVersion>.

Docs.exception: represents an invalid handle.
is .
does not represent a elliptic curve (EC) key.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Security.Cryptography.SafeEvpPKeyHandle DuplicateKeyHandle() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a representation of the cryptographic key.
Docs.returns: A representation of the cryptographic key.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Each call to this method produces a new <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SafeEvpPKeyHandle> object with its own lifetime. The objects returned by this method can safely be used even after this <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDiffieHellmanOpenSsl> instance has been disposed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters ExportExplicitParameters(bool includePrivateParameters) cil managed
Public Overrides Function ExportExplicitParameters (includePrivateParameters As Boolean) As ECParameters

Docs.param: to include private parameters; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Exports either the public or the public and private key information using the explicit curve form from the current key to an structure so that it can be passed to the method.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the point on the curve for this key, using the explicit curve format.
Docs.exception: The method cannot obtain curve values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters ExportParameters(bool includePrivateParameters) cil managed
Public Overrides Function ExportParameters (includePrivateParameters As Boolean) As ECParameters

Docs.param: to include private parameters; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Exports the key used by the object into an object.
Docs.returns: The key and named curve parameters used by the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the key was created as a named curve, the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.Curve?displayProperty=nameWithType> field contains named curve parameters; otherwise, it contains explicit parameters.

Docs.exception: The method cannot obtain curve values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void GenerateKey(valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.ECCurve curve) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub GenerateKey (curve As ECCurve)

Docs.param: The curve used to generate an ephemeral public/private key pair.
Docs.summary: Generates a new ephemeral public/private key pair for the specified curve.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `curve` must validate (that is, it must return true when passed to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECCurve.Validate?displayProperty=nameWithType> method) and must not be implicit.

Docs.exception: does not validate.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void ImportParameters(valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters parameters) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub ImportParameters (parameters As ECParameters)

Docs.param: The curve's parameters to import.
Docs.summary: Imports the specified parameters for an object as a key into the current instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDiffieHellmanCng.ImportParameters%2A> method replaces the existing key that this object is working with by creating a new <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKey> object. If `parameters` contains only the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.Q> field, then only a public key is imported. If `parameters` also contains <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.D>, then a full key pair is be imported. The `parameter` <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.Curve> value specifies the type of the curve to import.

Docs.exception: does not validate.
references a curve that cannot be imported.
references a curve that is not supported by this platform.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property PublicKey As ECDiffieHellmanPublicKey

Docs.summary: Gets the public key that can be used by another object to generate a shared secret agreement.
Docs.value: The public key that is associated with this instance of the object.
